column6: My wife and I ate there on Monday, 27 December when we were looking for a nice lunch. Everything was excellent. The Tortilla Soup was great as were the tacos. Highly recommend it.

Perfectly located in the theatre district, especially close to the theaters in the high '40s and low '50s, this is a main draw. Additionally, the menu truly has something to satisfy every Mexican food craving from tacos to bowls. I ordered the shrimp bowl over rice, which had a generous serving of fish and a tasty sauce topping all. Margaritas hit the mark and, overall, was a perfect pre-show meal.

I was between 3-4 stars, but the great service pushed it upward. I ordered takeaway for a few people and the staff were super helpful. The order was ready quickly and packaged nicely into a to-go bag. The place itself is super cute and has a tiki bar feel. The drinks looked nice, but I wasn't able to try one. It is very convenient to Central Park where I was meeting up with others. The burritos themselves were ok. Constructed well to keep everything from falling apart, but we found them to be a little dry. We did enjoy the green salsa that comes with the chips. If I am in the neighborhood I'd give them a second try to see if a different order is better.
Ordered online for a quick carry out. Great food great service nice people. Loved it!
No comment
Delightful, patio - delish bowl. Simple yet delicious! I had a spicy margarita and a bowl with wild mushrooms, very satisfying!

Really friendly service, but my burrito was $14, pretty small, more than half rice, and the non-rice fillings weren't that great (chicken). Maybe other stuff is better, but I'd never get another burrito from here again.
Luv their tacos,  good cocktails and best is their customer services is spit on. Very friendly. Thanks for making my lunch enjoyable!
No comment

Great Mexican food!! Food wasn't heavy but filling. The appetizer, guacamole, was super good. Drinks were great. They had a variety of salsas from mild to crazy spicy. Enjoyed it right before the show! 2 thumbs up!!

It is hard to find a decently priced place for lunch near MOMA.  Azule Cantina was great. I had a burrito bowl with chicken. Portion was very generous and well seasoned. Highly recommend this place. Get

Azule Cantina is the place to be! The bartender Jocelyn (she works closing) makes the best drinks and her costumer service is amazing! The food is great also, my favorites are the nachos and the quesadillas! Definitely a must try!
The service is amazing everybody is so nice. The food is amazing. The atmosphere is amazing very beachy the prices are amazing. If you are looking for a fun and good place to eat try this place
Tasty rice in the bowls that has some citrus in it. Good price point for the neighborhood.

Came here to try. We walk by a lot and see a line or wait time.  When were reservation. Realized the space is small that's why there is a wait time. Based on the reviews and the menu we were excited to try this place. The appetizers were mediocre. The spam fries super salty. But it's just cut up spam in the shape of fries. The skewer platter only one meat was good. The ribs were good. But over seasoned. The best thing we had was the beef tongue entree. The sauce and the tongue was done very well. First time here. And last time here. I would only come back for the beef tongue. Service is good.

The place is small, so I kinda understand staff were always clearing out our table every 5 minutes (pulling empty small plates, empty glasses, empty water bottles). That can get annoying, especially when you bring visitors from Canada and want to have discussions. The staff also wear these tops with wide flowing sleeves, and on one of the reach overs, the sleeve came too close to touching the food. When it happened again and the sleeve DID touch my food, I just couldn't finish the last few bites and just left my food unenjoyable.  I would have come back to try the rest of the menu, but this was a turn-off. We mentioned what happened to one of the staff, (manager?), who said they tell their staff to be conscious of this very issue.  Clearly we had someone who was not mindful of it at all.

Tried this venue after hearing it loosely referenced on a podcast. It was delicious. It's a small quaint spot with nice ambiance and a decent happy hour. But overall the food was just really tasty!

I had high hope with this place due to good reviews, but very disappointed with the quality of the foods. We ordered 2 cocktails, 3 appetizers and 2 main dishes. Rock shrimps was $12 for 4 pieces, the large skewers were all dried, no flavored tasted like they cooked over time and reheated. The steak with bone marrow was nothing special but high costs. Only the service was very decent and their karage congee was worth of trying but nothing special that makes me want to try this place again.

Oh my goodness. I went here with my in laws, husband and brother in law to celebrate a birthday. I was looking for a Filipino restaurant in the city and this happened to have great reviews. All I can say is we were sooo lucky to get a reservation and I couldn't have picked a better spot. The menu had some traditional Filipino dishes but with a twist. From the minute our server came out, service was unreal. He was so attentive and helped us choose our dishes. The short rib kare kare fell right off the bone and the mushroom tofu sisig was such a powerful combo of flavors even the meat lovers loved it! We even had a DJ entertain us for the night, but the best part was the volume level was kept at a reasonable level for dinner. My only downside is that I didn't get to try all of the other amazing dishes so it looks like I'll just have to come back. My recommendation is to make a reservation early because it gets busy!
No comment

The place was busy and bustling on a Friday night, but with a reservation we were seated right away. I love the concept of Filipino Japanese fusion served izakaya style. Even the interior was decorated in a tasteful way, paying homage to both heritages. We started off with the rock shrimp tempura, and chori sliders (both delicious!), I'd be interested to come back to try more of the small plates. For entrees we shared the bone marrow salpicao, and spicy yuzu adobo ribs. Both meat dishes were definitely noteworthy, and I'd recommend either equally for any carnivores looking to come in. This a small space on the lower East side, and it looked like there was some outdoor booths on the street. This is definitely a better experience if you're a couple or a small group.

This is one of the best value restaurants I've been to. The total bill for my group came out to $36 per person with tip included and we were very full. The servers are very on top of making sure everyone got their drink orders in for happy hour. All the dishes were so flavorful and the meat fell right off the bone. It was a great exposure to Filipino style cooking for my non Filipino friends and everyone. The spicy yuzu adobo ribs, truffle mushroom and tofu sisig, and the skewer platter were our favorite dishes. The yuzu gimlet cocktail tasted very good and the rizal highball was very strong.
No comment

First time visiting this restaurant to celebrate Valentine's Day, food was delicious, decent portions for the price, just wished the food was warmer when it was served. Will come back to try other menu items or try the Kamayan feast they offer for 8+ people!

What a fantastic dinner with their Kamayan. I got in touch with Vanessa who assisted in crafting a wonderful birthday experience for our group of 8. The food was impeccable and so delicious. We decided to do the add on of a half porchetta & 2 lobsters , but be warned that there is so so much food! Come hungry! You will not be let down at the beauty in their presentation. We also ordered 4 pitchers of their house sangria which was also honestly one of the best we've ever had. During the dinner, our waiter Lambert (I hope I spelt the name right), was such a caring and attentive person. The dining experience was elevated due to his incredible customer service. We wanted for nothing the whole night due to our man Lambert. You only really see this quality of service in ultra high end restaurants. Dont hesitate on this, reserve! We will come back! Thank you again for all you do!
I recommend this place. The food and service is great. If you are looking to relax and want to have a few drinks and would like to try out some filipino food, then this is the place....!

Gugu room is a must go. I got the best black sesame cocktail that went so well with everything we got. Highly recommend, and for food we got the kabab platter, shishito peppers, ginger stew with rice, short rib type of stew, you actually can't go wrong at all. Japanese Filipino fusion, great service, cool vibe, amazing food
No comment
The food, drinks, service, atmosphere, all of it was 5 stars! We had a few different cocktails and they were all super. The food was to die for and we can't wait to come back and try more!

I'd only recommend the skewers. I loved the variety and flavors. The adobo ribs were too salty and dry for my liking. The cod sisig wasn't anything special and had a lot of mayo drizzled on top. Also, the seating was very tight - when a table left, a waiter would shift the tables over. With that being said, the service was attentive.
The food was just ok for the price. I was particularly disappointed in the skewers, all of which were way too salty; the beef one was very overcooked.
No comment

A Filipino-Japanese izakaya?? I usually don't like "fusion" types of restaurants but this was great. My favorite of the night was the cod katsu sisig!!!!! Also had grilled skewers (chicken was so juicy) and mostly appetizers. Their chicken karaage came with the most delicious sauce ever. Cocktails were unique -- I love mango and yuzu so really liked that they're in cocktails! Would definitely come back to try all the other entrees.

Love this place for the weekend. Their skewers are so good. Don't regret getting their drinks - they are delicious and hit the spot. The service is good. Highly recommend the shrimp!

Great spot in LES, a fusion of Filipino and Japanese food with good cocktails! Staff was great and hospitable! Tried a variety of items the balut, intestines and more. Had a round of drinks there with friends and enjoyed! Definitely will be back to try more and definitely make a reservation!
No comment

apologize for the warm tone of these photos as we went for dinner and gugu room had monochromatic lights on... the rib-eye skewer was just fantastic!!!! Then the yellowtail (hamachi) collar and agedashi tofu were my second favorites. Would say the other dishes weren't bad but nothing extraordinary. The skewers were on the saltier side and the short rib kare kare surprisingly wasn't that salty, and I loved the eggplant touch. Also ordered the yuzu gimlet and margarita for cocktails - both very refreshing. Would say this place is definitely a vibe and if you come later (since they close at 1am) you might be able to catch a live dj set. The bar area looks like a cool place to hangout too.

Service was great, checked in frequently and made the experience warm, maybe the best service I've experienced in the City.  The flavors of the food was amazing, we got a skewer sampler and the intestine was a surprise favorite although every other skewer passed our expectations as well.  The Gugu express was flavorful and goes well with jasmine rice.  Chicken Karaage was a pleasant surprise as well, very juicy.  A great date spot with great food to pair.

Love love loveeeee this place. I came solo and sat at the bar. Ended up conversing with the staff several times since I was so close to their register. Lovely people and the drinksssss wow. That sangria was almost the size of my head. It was so good! The harumaki rolls were so fresh and came out piping hot. The outside was flaky and light and dipping it in the sauce just really brought it all together. The skewers were also very good I got the sampler where you can only get one of a flavor. Next time I'll grab an actual entree since these were so good and I bet other items are just a great if not better. If you do get the skewers my favorites were the ribeye and the chicken. Porkbelly (liempo) is normally my favorite but the other two took the cake. I was sitting at the bar and didn't look around much but the place was popular as expected. With great lighting and interiors I can see this being a cute date spot or just dinner with friends. 1000% you should go here!

I made a reservation the day before coming here, but was not told until we arrived that we would be sitting outside, which I think would have been nice to know since it was quite a warm and humid evening. Luckily we were able to run to the Duane Reade nearby to get some bug spray since there were swarms of mosquitos out there. The table they put us at looked large enough for about 5 people, but they put 7 of us there which was quite tight and uncomfortable. Some people in our party ended up ordering their own separate entrees, so when they asked if they should wait to bring out the food all together we said yes, but in the end they brought them out individually so some dishes got cold while people were waiting on food. Additionally, there was some confusion on how many rices we had ordered but the guy was nice and let us keep an extra rice without charging.  The cod katsu sisig was pretty tasty and probably my favorite dish. The Laing was nice but nothing super special. The short rib kare kare meat was extremely bland but did have a nice texture. The Gugu express was a bit too oily for our taste and didn't have the most appetizing flavor to us. Overall, the food was interesting, but I'm not sure I'd come back again.

On the whole, the food was delicious. I absolutely loved the gugu express and the chicken kaarage congee. The flavors were so unique and complex. Their wasabi margarita was also unexpected and phenomenal. Great happy hour (the margarita was only $10)!

A new Filipino Izakaya restaurant in lower east side - I appreciate the style and vibe they're bringing to the area. I would definitely go back to enjoy the skewers and the cocktails, but they do need to improve on their entrees overall. For the price point they're asking for, it was somewhat lacking in cooking technique and presentation - especially the dishes with the bone marrows.

Get the shrimp tempura and cod, skip the expensive pork belly (you're right next to Chinatown), the peanut sauce didn't help the flavorless short rib that was only 1 piece. Chicken karaage could have used more batter or make it crispier. Total bill was $109 with tax and 20% tip for 2 ppl.

always a great time here! food is good, drinks are good, service is goos, and vibes are good especially when they have a dj playing. im filipino and can confirm they do a great job of putting a modern twist on filipino classics
No comment

What a great vibe! Small, delicious, savory dishes - friendly staff - fun drinks - busy vibe. This was a real modern, Filipino, gem that me and my friend knew we'd immediately return to. Filipino Tacos. Skewers. The works.
No comment

Dinner was not good. Within a five minute time span, two staff came by to ask if my friend and I wanted drinks. Seriously?! Beef skewer was tough, chewy and salty. Could barely pull the meat off the short rib. And the table next to us probably knows the owners/staff. They went to the back somewhere and came back smelling like incense. Nasty incense. It was so gross! The only thing item that tasted good was the ebi taco. And there is no signage on the property. I had to look at pictures of the exterior others have taken to confirm this was the restaurant. Does it make the place classier and more upscale since it's more secretive without the signage? And the chair was some cheap metal chair. The back was low and uncomfortable.

Wanted to to try this new spot. The service was great and everything we had was very good. The kare kare was amazing. The ribeye yakitori was my favorite, super tender and flavorful.
You will sit next to hot trash.  Do not attend on Sundays or any day frankly.  Aboid avoid

HH white sangria til 8pm and only $25! It's weak and watered down but tastes good. Out of everything we ordered (fries, adoba chicken, short rib udon, truffled mushrooms) the udon was SO GOOD. I saw that they had a really good brunch offer so will be coming again to check it out.

Not a bad place, not a great place. Overhyped for the high prices on these menu items. Setting is unique, kind of a clubby feel to it with a disco ball at the bar space. Not a bang for your buck restaurant however. No red flags or major issues, service was speedy but also there's just way better options out there that don't gouge your wallet. Two mains, one app, 2 drinks and a tip came to $100 for two. I'd probably go patio if the weather permits because the spacing inside is tight and you're basically on top of each other. Quality is decent, but nothing to write home about overall. I'd go once to try if you have a japanese/filipino background if you're curious!
No comment
A group of us decided to go last minute and it was amazing! We ordered a bunch of plates to share and everything was really good from the apps to the mains. Their drinks are also great!

Here goes my first written bad review ever. The food got progressively worse as we ordered lol. The chicken karaagr was amazing! The isaw was good but some pieces weren't cooked properly, we could barely bite through it. The mushroom sisig wasn't anything special, could barely taste the truffle. No sisig element in it besides literally being in a sisig pot. The bone marrow udon was so flavorless we barely touched it and just left. Really wanted to like this place, but I'm glad I got to confirm the bad reviews here for myself and got over the fomo.

I recently had dinner at GuGu room it was a wonderful dining experience the rock shrimp and there short rib and curry sauce their crab meat salad were all well prepared and seasoned and I really enjoyed their sweet potato fries with that special sauce

Excellent Filipino Japanese fusion food.  I was lucky to try their grilled chicken inasal, shrimp, longgoniza bbque and pritchon at a catered party the night before and came back to try the ala carte menu consisting of kare-kare, laing, garlic rice, etc.  It was all so delicious and memorable.  Well done, Gugu Room.

Clean positive vibes, exceptional service, friendly staff, it was a yelp recommendation, I'm not disappointed, the wasabi margarita was surprisingly delicious, everything is great I will return for sure for more experience

In a word: delicious! Filipino food elevated in a fun, surprising way (read: unpretentious)! Really great service and ambience as icing on the cake. I live very close to Little Manila, but will make the trek to Manhattan when I'm looking for a refreshing change from our comfort food staples!

column3: Lower East Side, New York, NY
column6: Omg! I love the food! It is so amazing! It's like being back home in Iloilo. I went out for a drink with a co worker who is the same city as me in Philippines. We love the food and drinks complement them! I will be back!!!

Went here to celebrate my boyfriend's birthday tonight and it did not disappoint. Yummy cocktails  (my favorite was the Langka Lemongrass) and a really delicious variety of dishes to choose from. The skewers were our favorite overall, but everything was good! Will definitely go back and recommend to friends!

Had an amazing time at Gugu Room! I had made a reservation for dinner but was running late and the staff was very accommodating to make sure I still had a space. The staff was friendly and welcoming and great at explaining menu items/suggesting cocktails. I'm still thinking about the chicken karaage and the spicy tori curry. The cocktail menu also had many unique items so there was something for everyone. Definitely coming back here to try more of the drinks. Such a cute place with a great vibe and they also have a dj some nights!
Best food & bar around lower east side. If you guys are looking for something different, this is totally an experience to try!

Not a good place to eat. Their food is not that good and their service is worse. We went there to celebrate our colleagues birthday, 15 of us. They ask us to leave because some other big group is coming while we're still eating. How rude was that.! Not recommending this to anyone. At all!!

really good filipino breakfast. the bistek was a little on the sour side, but i liked it. the chicken tecino was really tasty. don't have much complaints just high quality filipino meals. want to try the karaage next time
No comment

Had a fantastic time at Gugu on Sunday evening. We were a group of 9 with a table near the DJ who started about 9. We shared a bunch of dishes, all of which were  great. My favorites were the Agedashi Tofu and the Rock Shrimp Tempura, but everything was really fresh, served quickly and so tasty. I previously lived in SF near Daly City and have been to a number of restaurants with excellent Filipino food so my expectations were high. They didn't disappoint. The vibe is perfect, good food, good drinks, good music, great time.

Tried this new Filipino-Japanese fusion restaurant on the lower east side. Food was absolutely fantastic! Imaginative Cocktails and an excellent selection of Japanese whiskies. Great vibe with great music. Wait staff friendly and attentive. Highly recommend this new gem. It is well worth seeking out.
Went here for Brunch. Good food, atmosphere and service! Bistek was phenomenal! Must go back to try their Dinner menu.

Indoor and outdoor ambience is great. The Short Rib Kare Kare and Tofu Kare Kare both had incredible flavor and texture. We got the Spring Rolls as a starter and they were good, but I would try something different next time.
Wow. Great food, fun vibe, can't be beat on the lower East side.  One of the best dining experiences in nyc.

Exceptional :) I really enjoyed my time here a few weeks ago. The vibes were amazing - great ambience, friendly staff, KILLER drinks. Each drink was so unique and there's definitely something for everyone. I highly recommend the rock shrimp tempura and the spicy Tori curry!!
Love the vibe here! Every single dish we had was  sooo tender. Faves would have to be the bagnet and rock shrimp tempura. They also have a well curated drinks menu that you should check out.

Really not a fan of the chicken ramen here but the Chirashi bowl was good! Maybe err on the side of the sushi over the ramen. The takoyaki wasn't bad either. Currently BYOB. Nice to have another not too crazy expensive option in Hudson Yards!

I usually go to the Suram location on UWS, it's one of my favorite sushi spots. Happily stumbled across this new location a few weeks ago while looking for a snack in the Hudson Yards area. The interior is beautiful and spacious. The sushi was delicious and fresh. I like the spicy tuna roll and their special rolls (three and four) are also very good. Service was great - fast and attentive.
Great food.  Great ambiance!  Excellent service!! From appetizers to dinner all was amazing

New place in the neighborhood, had to check it out. Cute decor. Attentive staff, especially during dinner rush. We love it when waiters know when to fill our (nearly) empty water glasses. The ramen was delicious, though I wish it was pork chasu (they only serve chicken). I did ask for no bamboo shoots, but I found two tiny ones in my bowl. The sushi was decent
No comment

We had such a great dinner here. Walked in straight from checking into our nearby hotel and were seated right away (only 2 of us). Service was prompt, helpful and even jovial, which was appreciated. We eat sushi quite often, and the signature rolls Six and Eight were up to par, but the crispy rice dishes were the star of the meal! We were in and out as quickly as we needed but felt we could have lingered longer if we wanted. Solid choice that we would return to again.
Delicious ramen soup! Great and clean place to visit. Service was fabulous as always, will come back!

Top notch sushi, great pricing. Food was delicious and the service was spot on. Great vibe with a friendly staff. Great addition to the neighborhood. Looking forward to the opening of their event space for corporate events.

Reviewing here because my 1 star review on Google does not show up. Had the Rock Shrimp Tempura on a takeout order that we came to pick up. Took one bite and stopped eating because THEY DID NOT REMOVE THE POOP TRACT FROM THE SHRIMP. Absolutely disgusting. I live across the street and will now go out of my way to never return. FILTHY!!!

Wow, what an amazing place! This was some of the best ramen I have ever had. The ambience and decor of the interior was beautiful, the staff were all incredibly friendly. The broth of the ramen was so good I had to ask for an extra cup. The sushi was also fantastic, and they had some of the best crispy rice in the city. I am very fortunate to live so close to this new gem, and I will definitely be back for more!
No comment
Place is beautiful. Staff is so attentive. Food is on point. And so affordable. So nice to have this place so close. Will be a regular here

We ordered the rock shrimp, salmon fried rice, spicy tuna roll and the special roll 3. Overall it was extremely good and service was top notch. This is a new restaurant but we are so grateful it's in our neighborhood, we will definitely be back.

Great ramen and sushi! The wait was a little long but we got some hot tea to fight off the cold winds outside. The staff were all great and the sushi and ramen were delicious. Great vibes too, small dining room but it felt cozy! Will definitely go again if I'm in the area!

I live across the street and have been waiting for this location to open, and it did not disappoint! The interior is beautiful and calming, I forgot where I was for a second. The food was AMAZING. The quality of sushi was really great, the speed and attentive of service was also great. Best sushi you'll find in this direct area. OH and the best part - BYOB with no uncorking/service fee.
The food was fantastic, the service was good, and the ambiance was upscale. Highly recommended new restaurant in Hudson Yards.

A gem of a spot. I'm glad I got to go for lunch before it inevitably becomes the next hardest spot to get a reservation. I visited for lunch and was greeted by the loveliest and most eclectic of atmospheres. I love that every week the menu changes and that their ingredients are fresh! I thoroughly enjoyed everything  on their lunch menu. The value for what you get is amazing! Definitely will be back for dinner
No comment

Oh it's just the loveliest hole in a Brooklyn wall. The space is so inviting, the staff is cool and hot and queer and hip and friendly, and the food is always wildly impressive. Perfect for a celebration, or just a night out with loved ones. Cannot recommend this place enough.

Had the best time reuniting with 5 of my best friends from college. Such a fun concept and cool space. Was gonna have my birthday party here last December but they closed for covid, so I'm glad I was finally able to make it out for dinner.

This was such a well done beautifully executed experience. I truly did feel like I was at a dinner party at one of my close friends houses. The dinnerware is all mismatched and hand picked. Gives a nice chill, homey vibe. The food all came out timely and everything was really enjoyable. There's only one seating per night at 7:30 and this allows everyone in the restaurant to really take their time and also engaged with the servers and the head chef. We started out with a flatbread that was topped with warm goat cheese I believe, pears and arugula. Then we had a delicious fall squash based soup with pepitas on top and a delicious herb olive oil. Next we had a beef roast with mashed potatoes topped with radicchio  and olives. This was so flavorful it tasted like it was slow cooked all day. And to top off, molten chocolate cake for dessert. My absolute favorite part of the meal was chatting with the chef. The menu is set weekly on Mondays when they shop for whats in season. This makes everything taste really intentional. You don't have to spend time on picking something from the menu, you can just enjoy yourself!

Such a pretty spot & perfect for brunch. This spot offers a strict pre-fixe menu that changes based on chef's choice & seasonality. Had the sweetest sweet peas as a starter & some duck breast with chili oil + ramp (instead of scallion) pancakes. For dessert we had cornmeal pudding with candied mangoes. Wondering if this is a BYOB spot, just missed some spirited drinks but not complaining. They also served up some very refreshing iced coffee perfect for 90 degree day.

Came here for a birthday party and absolutely LOVED it! I wouldn't be surprised if it's pretty hard to get a reservation in an average evening because it's so small but I love spots like this that have limited seating and limited space, everything's so well curated and the restaurant itself is absolutely adorable. The staff was all so lovely and made the evening that much better. It's definitely a spot that lot of locals love but even if you're not from the area it is a great experience that I would highly recommend!
No comment
No comment
What a lovely charming place. I love the atmosphere and I love the pre fix. Great concept! Highly recommended! And if you have the chance to have their sourdough bread, what a treat!

Such a lovely concept for a restaurant. Truly a hidden gem in the area. The chef himself came out to thank us for coming and they even adjusted the menu to make it vegan for me. Everything was delicious but I have to say the japanese sweet potato was to die for! Highly recommend.

We came here for brunch, we loved how the place was decorated, how kind the staff was and people being true to the "dinner party" concept which was talking to strangers! The food was incredible and quite a good portion for $22. I can't wait to come back to try their dinner! I highly recommend !!
No comment
Cute concept but the food was incredibly lackluster. It felt like something a not particularly talented at cooking friend would feed you
Fantastic! Homey, beautiful space, delightful staff, and the most delicious food. A great communal space and place to return to again & again as the menu shifts.

Food and service were amazing!! Vibe is so cozy. The only thing I'd mention is that the drinks were really expensive but the prices weren't listed in the menu. We ended up paying just as much for drinks as we did for the meal, which was a bit of sticker shock. But I will definitely come back and either BYO (which I saw others do) or just ask ahead of time :)
No comment
Couldn't ask for a more authentic home-cooked meal by the nicest people ever. Our 3rd visit. Love you guys. See you soon.

A New York gem. Really good food, adorable ambience, nice staff. A great neighborhood place. Their lunch picnic boxes are gourmet but for the same price as you can buy basically anything -- 16 or 18 bucks. Pretty sweet deal! This spot is new to the neighborhood, support them!
dinner party is an absolute delight. Every menu is thoughtful and scrumptious. Their sourdough goes OFF. Feels like home away from home. Also All the staff are really hot.
Impeccable service, food, and vibes. The owner and staff care so much about this place, and you can taste it in the food!!!

I was too excited and hungry to take a picture of my food. This place is my favorite Lebanese bakery in NYC. they have all the classic Lebanese options, and you can never go wrong with a plain zaatar. I also have tried lahim bi ajin and it's super tasty. I also took my non-Lebanese friend to this cafe and she was a huge fan!
No comment

This is the best manaeesh in the city. I love the crispy bread. it tastes very flavorful. It gets hot inside but they have outdoor seating. Service is fast and they are always nice. I will say however the knafe is the worse knafe I've ever tasted in my life. I wish they would buy the frozen one from the Arabic store and sell it bc it would taste better than what they sold me lol it was like jelly knafe. But the zataar manaeesh it is so good, a little pricey, mine was $11 but overall I would go Everytime I'm shopping around soho or if I go to the NYU masjid.

Sort of tasted like cheesecake with the bottom but had a sort of savory crunchy graham like too. Wish I knew what flavors were in it. Wish I wasn't too full to try regular food, I will have to go back!

Reminded me of Syria's Lahm Bajin. The Zaatar was perfect as well, but the prices did not fit the portion. The thin bread was perfect! The Knafa did not look authentic so being Arab I stayed away lool.. overall will luv to have more of the pies there

Delicious Lebanese flatbreads- always get cocktail, variety of vegetarian options. Relatively cheap, very tasty and fresh. Service is always quick and kind. Frequently bring out of towners- unique and delicious.

I am surprised I haven't written a review about Manousheh seeing that I stop by this place every time I get a chance. I love it! If you're craving FLAVOR and are short in time, Manousheh is the answer! I love the Zaatar with veggies, a lot of veggies. Their garlic hot sauce is a must have for me and their little sweet treats made out of pistachios and/or walnuts are amazing. Stop by and find your new obsession. Seriously

If you love brick oven anything, you'll love Manousheh's zaatar & jibneh. It's a cross between a flat bread and cracker with Lebanese cheeses and spice. Plus, it's super fresh and delicious. Staff are kind and courteous. Go now, you won't regret it. Good for a quick and tasty bite at great prices.
This is one of my favorite places in NYC. It strikes the perfect balance between healthy and delicious.
Love it.  can't until I go back to NY and have more.  Once I had three manoushehs in the same day!  even better than Lebanon!
The best taste ever, it really feels like am back home and am tasting the Lebanese famous breakfast "manoushe"

Za'atar bread was ON POINT. The place is very small - seating for probably less than 15 people - but you should still visit, if just to make an order for take out. All the orders are made fresh and baked right in front of you. Service was also really great - quick and friendly. Highly recommend.

Manousheh catered our event (150 people) and did an amazing job. The food was delicious and arrived well presented and on time. The managers and delivery staff were polite and helpful throughout the planning of the event. Would definitely recommend Manousheh!!

This is one of those hidden gems in Manhattan that has incredible food at an accessible price. Not to mention that it's an authentic representation of Lebanese cuisine, with a friendly staff. The avocado veggie wrap is not to be missed. Perfect stop if you're going to movie nearby. I will definitely be back.

I go back to Beirut every 3 years and I can say that this place is way better than a majority of the places there. The dough is great along with the zaatar and jbneh. The lahm is also a must try. Always a good vibe and the workers are very friendly. I suggest you stop thinking about it and try it.

This place is the real deal! Very authentic flavors and everything is so delicious and fresh. Honestly some of the best zataar and jibneh I've ever had and I've had plenty in the Middle East. I wish I lived next door to this little gem, I'd stop by every morning. The owner is extremely helpful and all of the staff was very polite! The dough is baked right in front of you like it is in a pizza shop (this is kind of like middle eastern pizza anyway). It's so soft and delicious. I can't wait to go back. Highly recommend it! Take a break from the falafel on Macdougal and come here instead. I hope this place stays around for a very long time!

This place was awesome. Great food and helpful staff. The Zatar is tasty. It's not an instant fast food piece so expect to be patient as it is baking but let me tell you it's worth the wait. Sooooo good. My first taste of Beirut
The staff is horrible, food is not what it used to be. That's a shame I used to love this place but they need to do something right now especially about the employees!!

Tried this place for the first time.  Food itself was fine. However, sodas are through the roof. 2-3 for a simple can or bottle.  Hot sauce was 1 extra.  Cmon.  Business 101 is made the ethic food why you go back multiple times. But soda is cheap, make that reasonable and hot sauce free.  Considering going back to try something else but without a soft drink.  Beer was 6, which is more reasonable
No comment
The laham bi ajina is exceptional. Crusty dough and creamy meat/tomato sauce. Take two!

Great cheap eats. I love the "cocktail". The staff is very friendly. The food is piping hot. It's quick and filling. Not a lot of seating but Washington Square Park is so close, in good weather go sit in the park and enjoy. A good addition to the neighborhood.

I loved this place! I came on a Sunday for lunch and luckily scored one of the very, very few tables. I came in wanting the lahem bi ajine, but I saw someone had ordered a very creative manousheh with crushed falafel! Wonderful decision -- it was $5, massive, and topped with incredible falafel, tomatoes, beets, maybe pickles, and the very best tahini I've ever had. It was huge, but so delicious that I almost wanted a second! I'll totally be back! Only complaints were that the line moved pretty slowly, and they had run out of coffee by noon. Nevertheless, I'll be back whenever I'm in the area!

Seriously good manousheh! Just went for the first time tonight and have to agree with everyone else, this is the best manousheh you will get outside of Beirut. Delicious. My favorite is the jibneh, but I will be back to try every single one! Great prices and extremely friendly staff. I will be back again and again.

Worth a stop if you are in the neighborhood or a special visit. Manousheh, is a traditional lebanese baked dough with a thyme mix. It is delicious here. I recommend you get it with labne (strained yogurt) and avocado. The cheese manousheh is very good as well. Their lahmebajine (kind of like a thin crust pizza) is delicious. I can't wait to go back for a spinach pie.
SOOOO good!  Staff is so sweet and helpful, they take credit cards with no minimum, and the food is just awesome.  Try the Zaatar with Labneh and their coffee - really yummy, I need another fix!
No comment
No comment
Nice little Beiruti spot in the Village. Delicious kafta, zaatar, and labneh. Was in a rush so didn't have time for coffee, but it smelled delicious.
Very interesting food. Good options for vegetarians too. We went there twice. Once for dinner. The other time for dessert. The peanut powder one (sweet) was very good.
No comment

Wow the kafta and bowl were BOMB! A quick enough meal that was flavorful in EVERY bite. The cashier gave us a portion of the delicious hot paste on the side for free even though it was lovingly made on site, the effort and care was evident when we put it on EVERYTHING

Manousheh is a delicious take-out joint in the village. I ordered the Cocktail thyme and cheese flatbread, and the flavors were complementary. I also tried the avocado zaatar which was equally as delicious. I loved watching them make the bread in their specialty oven right in front of me! If you want a quick Middle Eastern lunch, give this place a try!
As it turns out, a trainee was working during that time. I got follow up service later which ended by full refund. I am touched by their courtesy.

I had two servings of Lahem bi Ajine (flatbread with ground beef) -- they were crispy and delicious. The beef baked into the bread was savory. These are definitely ideal for either a snack or a light meal.
The food was absolutely amazing! They have great vegan options too. I felt healthy but also satisfied while eating their food which is a rare occurrence.
No comment

Manousheh is all about the bread. All about it. The bread is delish. Seriously. Za3tar isn't too bad either. My favorite combo is Za3tar w cheese + add vegies for extra $, but so worth it. The Dessert (nuttella w bread) is deslish as well. I'd recommend this place for sure!
really friendly service, but not a huge fan of the food. offers discounts to nyu students

Had their Lahem bi ajine. Very tasty. Food came out very fast. Ingredients tasted fresh and dough was very delicious. Meat could have used more seasoning and char but overall decent snack. Also  atmosphere was appropriate and staff very nice.
There wasn't anything bad about this place necessarily, but I don't get what the appeal is. Expensive flatbread that tastes like a matzoh cracker and has a little sprinkling of meat on it?...pass
Best and most convenient Lebanese manousheh in Manhattan. Affordable, delicious, open late.
expensive yes but also refreshing, light, healthy and tasty. zaatar-avocado that s what i m talking about

Tucked away near NYU, is Manousheh, a small lebanese restaurant that has a simple menu comprised of traditional breads with fresh ingredients. The food is made to order, and if you check-in on yelp, you can receive a free tea or coffee. I was surprised that the wraps/flat breads were served cold. I was expecting that they would be warm given the bread is made to order. I suppose since the flat bread is so thin that it cools quite quickly after leaving the stone oven. The Lahem Bi Ajine was ok (IMO, would have been better if it wasn't cold - cold ground meat doesn't seem right). The star of the show was the zaatar with veggies & avocado. The mixture of raw veggies, herbs and olives encased in a crispy thin wrap made for several delicious bites! The 'wrap' is really large, but since the stuffing is light, you can easily finish one. Seating is limited to a few stools and two small tables, so grab your zaatar and take it to the nearby park to eat.
Get the avocado-zaatar. Great service. Fresh food. Perfect for those who crave an alternative to the greasy and heavy.  My palate was pleased.

Manousheh is one of my favorite places in the Greenwich village. I come here for a snack, lunch, dinner... pretty much anytime I am hungry. The staff is friendly and fun; and the food is delicious and full of flavor... plus it is such great value for the price!

Ahhhhh so damn good. The bread is so fresh, and that zatar mix is so perfect, I can't help but eating there about a half dozen times a week. So glad These guys are in my hood now. I keep going back for the vegan option with the avocado, it's literally the perfect lunch.
hot damn this food is good. everyone should eat here and eat here often. the food is fresh and flavorful. the prices are also really great.

The manousheh and kishek are delicious but the Avo Salad is to die for! The space is very small but they do a great job managing the crowds at lunch time. I have yet to go in for breakfast but they advertise free coffee with your order!

Pretty great! I got the zaatar with a side of labneh, which was crucial! I was not expecting the intense savory and deep flavors so it was nice to break it up with the labneh (yogurt). Brought the extra home and almost thought about putting honey on it - would have been delicious!
No comment

At this quaint little place near MacDougall, is some authentic Lebanese food, my friend recommended me. God, were they right or right. Absolutely in love my Kishek which is a flat bread with tomatoes,yogurt,potatoes and sesame seeds, all blended into a smooth sauce. I haven't had authentic Lebanese before, but if this is what Lebanese even remotely resembles. Then I am in love with this place.

I 100% love this place. I'm Lebanese and I have to say this is the best manousheh I've ever had outside of Beirut. It's unbelievable how authentic and delicious they are! I also really adore the restaurant itself - perfect little unpretentious spot. If you go on the weekend, it's like a Lebanese family reunion. Anytime someone asks me for a good Lebanese recommendation in the city, I point them to Manousheh first. And the fact that they deliver (all the way uptown too!) is just another bonus.
Amazing, authentic, awesome, fresh, the "real deal". Tight quarters, but the food is worth it.
Nice wrap dough but the meat (both chicken and kafta) is quite dry. And you can get the worst hot tea for $3 out there.

My first time trying Lebanese flatbread, and haven't looked back. They're so incredibly flavorful and delicious! Our office gets catering from here all the time and it's always a huge hit! Definitely recommend
Really good food and really good customer service I highly recommend this place to anyone visiting in the bye area . Great vibes and atmosphere

This place is an awesome addition to the neighborhood. I love having a reliable option that is totally different from all the other restaurants. I usually go with the zaatar and add some vegetables, and it's freakin' delicious.  Quick, tasty, and healthy-ish cuisine earn a 5 star review. Put Manousheh at the top of your list for places to grab a bite.
Excellent. Authentic, great ingredients, well made and friendly service. Loved the backgammon too
No comment

Best Manoushe in town! So authentic and fresh, and the service is super fast and friendly. If you enjoy Lebanese food I would definitely recommend this place especially for breakfast. One of my favorite places in NYC!
Lots of savory little flatbreads and wraps. Not your place if you're looking for protein though.

Love the fine grain middle eastern coffee. They added cardamom to it which was a great touch. The Za'atar/Avocado was really flavorful, fresh baked in their oven with good quality ingredients. Will be returning soon for lunch soon.

I've been hooked since the original Kenmare pop-up location. Manousheh is a total spot: fresh concept, authentic ingredients and chill vibes. Za'atar (for those who aren't aware) is Middle Eastern crack, and the impeccable branding/art direction of the space completes the experience. A perfect addition to MacDougal that's a fun, fast and classier street food alternative than those gritty carts, and unlike the latter the clean-eats crowd won't be left tripping on guilt afterward.
Great manousheh! Nice spot for a quick lunch! (But only a few tables inside, but you can take away and eat in one of the parks!)

I live and work on the UES and still make it to this place 2x/week...it's worth the long subway ride. Food is very authentic and fresh. The Avocado zatar is heavenly. Order it to go and sit in Washington square park...close your eyes and you are in Lebanon! The food is poetry.
One of my favorite gems in Manhattan. A true, authentic Beiruty cafe. The workers were really nice Lebanese people and the Labne sandwich I got was perfectly cooked.

Just stopped here for a quick bite: wow! Delicious Lebanese street food you just don't find in New York, served super fresh! Loved meeting Ziad, who opened this fabulous addition to the west village in March.
The labneh is the tops. The bread is really on spot.
Very Yummy!  Great for a light lunch.  Avocado and Zaatar is great and so is their Jibneh!

Just had the zaatar n cheese combo with veggies and it truly made it feel like I was in Beirut in Hamra grabbing one on the way to school. The dough was perfect, nice n crisp and the veggies were really fresh. You can also opt for their homemade hot sauce if you're feeling it. Finally, what really hit the nerve was the background music they had... Fairouz of course. Will be back soon.
3.5 stars. 3 stars for the zaatar and the spinach/tomato flatbread, 4 stars for the avocado zaatar.
So good! This was worth the hype. Get the avocado one & plunge in. Mint. Mint is the key.

Anybody who loves authentic Lebanese food should go here. I got food catered for my party and they went above and beyond to make sure our food was perfect! All my friends loved the food! Thank you so much Manousheh for helping me out on Saturday September 30th!!

Also sorry to not give 5 stars because my food was DELICIOUS, but I ordered one zaatar and one labne and was surprised to get back to my office and open my takeout bag and realize they had given me one zaatar/labne and one ground beef?  I'm not sure exactly what went wrong, but I am vegetarian so that was disappointing.  Also, while the staff was super nice, I did notice they seemed a little disorganized and like they didn't have their process quite down yet.  In any case, I am still looking forward to many tasty lunches :)
It's about time NYC got a Manousheh place. They're simple yet excellent! Cooked perfectly, love them with a hot cup of tea with mint.

If you haven't been here you are quite simply missing out. It's DELICIOUS. I completely approve of this place, as a very authentic Lebanese joint! Their name comes from their signature "manousheh" a Lebanese breakfast staple. Really though, manoushe can be enjoyed any time of the day. It's like a pizza, but the dough is super soft and comforting, and forget the tomato sauce. I order the "cocktail" which is cheese mixed with a spice blend called Zaatar, another Lebanese classic (thyme and sesame seeds). If you don't want to try something  new, go for the labne (a smooth creamy cheese spread) or the meat manoushe, but if you have a more adventurous palate, the cocktail is a must. I really love this place, and I'm so glad that I can relish in the warm tastes of a far away home, right here in NYC.
Delicious, fresh and healthy! Took a small amount of time to make but that's not surprising when it's made fresh. Prices are awesome too. Would definitely be coming back.

This place is very delicious! I stumbled into it randomly when it was just a pop-up in soho, and liked it so much that I followed them on Twitter - the first time I ever followed a restaurant. Thankfully they finally have a permanent location. Everything I've tried has been good, both the traditional and new dishes.
Delicious and fresh food. I tried the Zaatar Jibneh, Labneh, Lahem Bi Ajine and Jibneh (Cheese) and all of them taste really good, but the Jibneh is by far my favorite. Friendly staff.

I don't even know the name of the dish! The flavor is avocado and zaatar! It's a huge wrap (very long!) with super fresh thyme, avocado, cucumber, tomatoes and olives~ I had a cookie with mashed dates. It tastes very familiar!
perfect!  couldn't ask for a better quick pick me up snack.  mmmm!
I love this place. The environment feels like home. Everything I tasted was delicious. And everyone who worked there had a high vibration, without being annoying.
This was honestly...crazy delicious. Hit the spot. No nonsense, tasty food. Will definitely be coming again.

Ordered the jibneh all dressed and it was amazing! I'd say this is one of the best manakish I've had in North America. The line was pretty long because I went on a Saturday afternoon during lunchtime but the service was good and they were fast. It was worth the wait because everything tasted super fresh!!! Yum!!!
As a Middle Eastern person who has lived in that region this is authentic and super tasty. Get the zaatar-jibneh and you will be smiling while you eat.

Everything is freshly made and pretty good. The menu could have a bit more explanation - and they should differentiate which dishes are traditional and which are more fusion. Also, they cut the veggies a bit large compared to the real thing. So, subtracting one star. But if you are in the nabe and looking for something light but flavorful - check it out. Also, the mint tea was quite good.
Grew up on my mother's amazing mnaeesh, and this authentic place gives hers a run for her money.  Amazing!
One of the best Manousheh I've ever had! Not to mention the friendliest staff ever. Love it!

Simply fresh and delicious!! I'm so happy that there is finally a Manousheh shop in NYC, seriously it's about time, and this joint hits the spot. For those of you who don't know, a manousheh is a very popular Lebanese flatbread sandwich that is baked fresh, I prefer plain cheese but I do love them all. The bread is hot and soft and it's in perfect ratio with the cheese. I ordered one of everything out of plain excitement, and contrary to what a previous reviewer posted, it's ALL made fresh. Truth be told, I don't think you could find better in Beirut. Ok enough about the food, cuz I'm making myself hungry again, the staff is wonderful, they are friendly and well informed, warm and inviting. The place is super cozy and is sure to be a gem in NYC!!
Yam! Sooo delicious! We were explained the small menu. The Zaatar + Jibneh is great, but the avocado + zaatar is worth a try too. Fast and yammy.
I would recommend adding the veggie option with mint to your manousheh. Very flavorful and filling.

What a wonderful new food experience. I had walked by a few times and hadn't had a chance to try it yet. I looked at the menu and didn't really understand how it worked and so I asked the staff and they were incredibly helpful and gave me good suggestions. It's basically a flatbread that is folded over with different fillings. I had the ground beef (which the staff member correctly said probably wasn't enough for one person) as well as the Za'atar which (with vegetables added, another great suggestion by the staff member) was definitely substantial enough for one person but together with the ground beef was perfect. A side of Labneh was great for dipping. For the two sandwiches it was 10 dollars plus $2 for veggies and $2 for a side of labneh. They were both absolutely delicious, with the Za'atar being very well spiced with great flavors of sesame and herbs and the ground beef was fantastic, so tender and well seasoned. I will absolutely be back here many times again in the future I can already tell.

Aywa! This spot is as sweet as a Fairouz song--shouts to my fellow Mid Easterners. After getting my doughy pie fix down the street at Keste (best pizza in the city), we stumbled across Manousheh and couldn't resist trying. Hailing from the Levant myself (Palestinian), I hold mana'eesh pies to a high standard and Lebanese ones are known to be the best. Unfortunately, authentic, old school, delicious mana'eesh are hard (even impossible) to find outside the Levant--but this place is spot-on! My father owned a mana'eesh spot in Jordan 20+ years ago, and walking in here instantly transported me back to my father's place: tiny and busy, smelling of dough, dried thyme, and Turkish coffee. Even their bottled water is imported from the homeland! The decor is awesome too, especially the Lebanese street signage that read, in Arabic and French, "Bleecker Street" and "City of New York." We'll most definitely tell everyone we know, and be back for an authentic taste of home.

the perfect substitute for that inevitable "walking down the street in NYC & can really use a slice of pizza" craving.  stopped in once and got a Zaatar to go. it really hit the spot. I walk past all the time and will be sure to stop back in to taste more of their flat bread delights. & the coffee sounds killer.

Walked by here one evening and noticed it bc there were so many people waiting to get in.  Came back on a Monday at 4 pm.  There was only one other person eating in- many others came in ordered and took it to go.  I tried 4 different items and loved each one   Thought it was great that they also offer beer and wine-which I think is a must with Lebanese food.  The guys behind the counter were nice. This will be my go to once a week since it is fairly priced and delicious.

I don't put up reviews often but I have to mention this: simply put, Manousheh is the best I've had outside of Lebanon - and is better than most of the places in Lebanon! Good job to all if the team for such good work, keep up the great job!
Excellent Lebanese wraps.  Try the Cocktail (cheese, thyme, zaatar) and add veggies.
Loved finding this little spot that makes my favorite food just like my mom does! It's small so carry out is best. Food tastes amazing and the staff is really nice!!
Fantastic Lebanese delights! Breads were bread in brick oven pipping Hot! Strong  Lebanese Coffee was laced in cardamon.  Delicious!!!

Unique and culturally traditional Lebanese street food. Similarly satisfying as slices of pizza only significantly more special - friendly, smiley, staff who joked with us and each other while he gave us a quick rundown on the food. It's places like this that really make New York special.

I'm really not sure if this place is under new management but the food is just not as good as it used to be. I have ordered from here A LOT in the past. The avocado zatar wrap was my favorite thing, I was literally obsessed with it...but the last five or so times I have ordered it, there is hardly anything in there and one of the times the avocado was completely unripe. I'm assuming they are trying to cut costs but it would be be much better if they raised the price but maintained their quality. I would be more than happy to pay more but get quality food. My wrap was quite literally more than 50% wrap. I'm pretty sure that's not the point of a wrap. They put so little avocado and zatar in there that I don't even know what's the point of calling it an avocado and zatar wrap. I haven't ordered from here for a long time (when I used to on average twice a week) and now I remember why. I keep thinking this is a one time thing (because again, I loved this place so so much) but after my last 5 or so orders it's clear that the quality has just seriously dipped. It's a shame. The jibneh is still the bomb though if that means anything.
Great wraps. Get the classic labneh, cucumber, tomatoes and olives with some Turkish coffee. It's awesome. They also have backgammon. It's a chill spot, great for quick bites to eat.

Unique flatbread wraps that are worthy of at least trying once. I ordered the za'atar manousheh, not knowing much about it besides that I enjoyed Taim's za'atar pita. One flatbread is huge and served wrapped up in parchment paper. I'd best describe it as similar to eating a Lebanese thin crust pizza. The bread is baked so perfectly - crispy, chewy, and doughy. I could eat it all day. The za'atar was tasty but became too salty for me after several bites and is the reason why I am docking one star. I'm not in a rush to come back, though if I did, I'd get something without za'atar seasoning.
It wa good but pricey.  I liked the vegetarian one the cheese one. I think it was called champagne or something.

great place, very authentic. bonjous juice, chiclet, unica, and even Rim water. been waiting a long time for a place like this. the oven is also from Lebanon. truly authentic place and needless to say that the maneesh are top notch
Their food is amazing. We tried many things in the menu and all were delicious. I wish there was a one in the upper east side :)

Amazing little pace with wonderful "flatbreads". I've had their tomatoes and beef one a hundred times and will return for a thousand more. Only problem is it's hard to try new ones once you find your favorite.
Lebanese fast food. You can get quite good lahmacun (thin crust Turkish pizza) with drinkable yogurt (ayran) duo. They sometimes make 2 lahmacun for $8 promotion too!

Great authentic Lebanese food, I tried Zaatar, Jibneh and Lahem Bi Ajine, And I loved them. I highly recommend it to any one who wants to tasty authentic Lebanese Manousheh. I will be there every time I visit New York.

Yummy!  And the nicest servers too. A real find! A friend and I split two items, both were great and tonight they had special desserts, mamoule (?) and we tried 2 of them. Delicious.  Highly recommend this place!
Love it , every thing here is delicious this is one of the best lebanese food in NYC .

Perfect place for lunch or a quick snack. Exceeded every expectation I had. Fresh, tasty, simple, light. Had the one with za'atar, labne, cucumber, olives, mint, and tomato. Added the hot sauce, which was tremendous.
Can we talk about how incredibly friendly the staff here are? This is a TREASURE in the heart of NYC. Thank you, Yelpers, for recommending this gem because I probably would have walked right by it.

What a find! We just happened upon it and asked people what they liked. Everyone seemed to have a favorite. We asked the guy at the register for recoomendations and he helpfully walked us through the menu and made some great suggestions. We got the "cocktail" and special spinach. Both were excellent. The prices were good, people friendly and food excellent. I just wish it was in my neighborhood!
Fresh, quality ingredients & deliciousness: all rolled into a perfect wrap to satisfy my hunger.

I've been here twice in four days, so you could say I'm a fan. AMAZING food. Great flavors. Fresh. Light. Super affordable. The staff is great and walks you through the menu (as I was clueless what to order). My friends heard about this place traveling throughout Lebanon so you know it's legit too. Definitely recommend and will be coming back for more!
Unbelievably good. The Labneh was flavorful and satisfying, and the Arabic Coffee with Cardamom was a great finish.

After the near perfect rating on yelp this was a must go when we visited the village, and the rates were comelling as well. I ordered Zaatar-Jibneh with other vegetables and the homemade garlic sauce was the star of the meal. If spicy is what you are looking for, definitely try the garlic sauce. I am going again to get the recipie for the garlic sauce.

A perfect spot for a quick but especially healthy lebanese sandwich ( or other Lebanese deliciousness) that is full of flavor and made with love and expertise! And one of the few places where healthy is also good for your budget! On top of that the service was impeccable

finally there are manoushes in nyc! the store is hip and cool, and the manoushes (really the plural is manaeesh ;)) are better than most i have in lebanon.. fresh ingredients and really excellent dough!

column3: Long Island City, New York, NY
column6: This place is amazing. My husband and I went here Friday night. We ordered 4 dishes, everything was so good. Duck Liver, blown my mind, one of the best I have ever tried in NYC. Beef Tenderlion, highly recommended. Cheese Soufflé is also recommended, I have never tried a soufflé like this. Will definitely come back.

Excellent experience. Service was top notch. Food was delicious and perfect prepared. We went for brunch and had a bottle of Austrian Riesling recommended by their Somm. She was so lovely and killed with every rec. finished with an Austrian dessert wine. We highly recommend this establishment. Executive chef was preset and making sure the whole restaurant was perfect. Only negative was I wish my chair was more comfortable. Great comfortable ambiance with highly executed comfort food. By the way, everything bread related was phenomenal.

Had a great brunch here. Ordered the duck parfait which was delicious. The smoked salmon and bagel was really good and not your typical platter with a really good bagel texture, flavorful fluffy cream cheese, and of course high quality salmon. Also got the pork schnitzel which was wonderful - very thin piece of breaded pork with lingonberry sauce and some cucumbers.

Excellent restaurant ! Initially I was intimidated by the menu and I wasn't sure if I would like it but everything was so good! We started with gougeres which was cheesy and delicious. I didn't love the sauce that went with it (friend did). Then we had the cheese soufflé (so soft!) and the beets (my least favorite but still good). I had the salmon en croute which was really excellent. My friends had the risotto and fennel tagliatelle both also really good. We ended with creme brulee and cheesecake excellent. Our server was so nice and helpful. Ambiance was nice as well - I just didn't love that you have to walk through a hotel to go to the bathroom and had a totally different feel. Would highly recommend

The entrance of Koloman is a little discrete, but when you walk in, you're greeted by a very stately, sophisticated interior. The service was impeccable - right away, they checked in our coats and took us to our table. The ambiance is slightly ruined by the crowd near the bar area, which didn't match the otherwise chic vibe of the restaurant, and the tables placed really close together. The standout here is definitely the salmon en croute - the perfectly crispy and buttery crust goes so well with the tender salmon and tangy beetroot sauce. The cheese soufflé and the gougeres (mainly bread and cheese with red wine shallots) were also noteworthy, practically melting in your mouth. I was disappointed, however, by the snapper crudo. I wasn't getting much flavor or texture in the dish. And of course, this place is extremely pricey, so the food didn't wow me the way I expected it to. The review by Pete Wells which awarded three stars to Koloman is incomplete.  A mention that the restaurant serves brunch prompted me to invite 3 guests to join me at this lauded restaurant on Sunday, Dec.11th.  My interaction with the hostess should have been a warning that this place was not ready for prime time.  She looked at my Open Table confirmation when she could not find my reservation and noted the 12:30PM time.  She was kind enough to point  out that 12:30 PM is dinner, not brunch, and I was kind enough to tell her that 12:30 PM is noon.  I should also note that Koloman had my credit card as security.  Finally crowded into a booth for four, we perused the menu and made our selections.  We opted for the simple  bacon and eggs, omelet and salads.  The scrambled eggs with bacon turned out to be a flat pancake with some bacon beneath the flattened eggs.  The other egg order received the same treatment; the bit of bacon buried beneath the eggs.  Along with the eggs, we were served a tiny portion of diced potatoes of no particular flavor  to A confusing join the no taste egg dishes.  Butter and jam were provided when requested.  The overall brunch was someone's idea of a Viennese repast, but failed on al counts.  Bacon was hard to find, meager, and hard to taste.  Eggs , adequate but tasteless, and no way scrambled in any cuisine.  The space, crowded and noisy, was hardly a 3 star experience.  Perhaps that is why Mr. wells did not explore or sample the brunch menu.  But we did and do not recommend it to anyone.
